thread.title: Leicester ramp up interest in Gaston Ramirez and Anderlecht’s £13m Kara Mbodji after bids rejected
thread.title_full: Leicester ramp up interest in Gaston Ramirez and Anderlecht’s £13m Kara Mbodji after bids rejected

author: smorgan
title: Leicester ramp up interest in Gaston Ramirez and Anderlecht’s £13m Kara Mbodji after bids rejected
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LEICESTER will ramp up their interest in Gaston Ramirez and Anderlecht’s £13million Kara Mbodji after they had bids rejected. 
Foxes boss Claudio Ranieri has had moves for both players turned down but will go again with transfer deadline approaching. PA:Press Association 3 Gaston Ramirez wants to leave Middlesbrough and join Leicester 
SunSport told you how Uruguayan forward Ramirez – who has handed in his transfer request to Aitor Karanka – could be replaced by Stoke’s Bojan. 
Boro will only sell if they can find a replacement. 
Senegal defender Mbodji is highly rated and Leicester have seen a £7million bid rejected. Getty Images Kara Mbodji is rated at £13million by Anderlecht and Leicester want to sign him Reuters Claudio Ranieri will look to seal his double swoop before the window closes tomorrow Derby County 2-2 Leicester City : Wes Morgan bullet header earns Foxes a replay Related stories UNITED ON FIRE Emergency services rush to Old Trafford as smoke is seen pouring from Manchester United's South Stand BURN BRADY BURN Burnley hoping to seal a £13million deal for Norwich's Republic of Ireland ace Robbie Brady Scouting with Girls Pep Guardiola watches Monaco play PSG alongside Russian supermodel Victoria Lopyreva ahead of Champions League tie TOON CHANCE ARM Crystal Palace and Newcastle in talks over Andros Townsend and Chancel Mbemba swap Gordon blue Chelsea make second bid for Celtic keeper Craig Gordon as Asmir Begovic replacement Wenger live Listen to Arsene Wenger's press conference ahead of tomorrow night's Premier League clash against Watford OUI GOT PAYET Dimitri Payet completes £25m Marseille move as West Ham chief David Sullivan blasts his lack of respect ROO LEAVING? Wayne Rooney's Manchester United future in doubt as Jose Mourinho also confirms Ashley Young could leave Pure Precision Danny Welbeck's stunning opener is crowned the Gillette Precision Play of the FA Cup Fourth Round ALAN SHEARER Teams who rested players cheated their fans and showed a lack of respect for the FA Cup and their opposition Transfers live All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window Pyro shame Portuguese League Cup final between Braga and Moreirense marred as players are hit by firecrackers from fans 
But Ranieri - whose side sit 15th in the table - is expected to return with a fresh offer. 
The 27-year-old has been on international duty at the Africa Cup of Nations but will return after his country were knocked out on penalties with Sadio Mane missing the decisive spot kick . 
Leicester have been looking to bring in defensive cover throughout the window and have failed to land Francesco Acerbi from Serie A side Sassuolo.
